column2: NORTH CAROLINA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: North Carolina

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This sign means:
column4: No traffic signal ahead
column8: The traffic signal is not operational

column2: 2. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column8: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column10: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.

column2: 3. This sign indicates:
column4: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column6: Double curve ahead. Slow your speed.
column8: Warning: drunk drivers.

column2: 4. This sign means:
column4: No Passing Zone
column8: Railroad crossing

column2: 5. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column6: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column8: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column10: another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 6. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Train intersection
column8: Parallel railroad crossing (crossroad)

column2: 7. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
column4: that a divided highway ends
column8: that a reversible lane starts.

column2: 8. A flashing yellow light:
column4: warns drivers to proceed with caution.
column6: can be found before reaching a sharp curve.
column8: is used at dangerous intersections.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: Low ground railroad crossing
column8: Winding road ahead

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: Construction zone ahead
column8: School zone ahead

column2: 11. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.
column8: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.
column10: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.

column2: 12. This sign indicates:
column4: Do not use your phone while driving
column8: Cell phone shop ahead

column2: 13. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
column4: must yield to
column8: must not yield to

column2: 14. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column4: Not if they are licensed bicyclists.
column8: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.
column10: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.

column2: 15. When driving on slick roads, drivers should:
column4: accelerate quickly.
column8: take turns more slowly.
column10: drive as they would on dry roads.

column2: 16. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: enter the right lane. When traffic permits, you can move out of the left lane.
column6: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.
column8: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.
column10: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.

column2: 17. A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
column4: Passing is permitted on the side of the solid yellow line
column6: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction
column8: Passing is permitted on the side of the broken yellow line
column10: Passing is not permitted in either direction

column2: 18. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column6: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.
column8: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.

column2: 19. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column6: Take your foot off the gas and shift to neutral.
column8: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column10: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.

column2: 20. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: move as far away from traffic as possible.
column6: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.
column8: always park on the left side of the roadway.

column2: 21. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column4: to signal all lane changes.
column6: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.
column8: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.

column2: 22. You license will be suspended if you are convicted of:
column4: failing to yield the right of way.
column8: driving without a license.

column2: 23. If another vehicle is approaching you head-on in your lane, you should _______, sound your horn and brake.
column4: steer left
column6: stay in the center of your lane
column8: steer right
column10: None of the other answers is correct.

column2: 24. ________ is the only effective way to reduce your Blood Alcohol Content (BAC).
column4: Drinking coffee
column8: Taking a cold shower

column2: 25. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Decrease pressure on the brake pedal if your wheels begin to lock.
column6: Allow the wheels to keep turning.
column8: Brake early and gently.

column2: 26. Never make a U-turn from:
column4: the lane you’re in.
column8: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.

column2: 27. If a vehicle using high beams comes toward you, look towards __________ of the road.
column4: the left side
column8: the right side

column2: 28. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
column4: Never use
column8: Always rely on
column10: It is not recommended to check

column2: 29. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs:
column4: has no effect, they are different substances.
column6: reduces the effects of the drug or medicine.
column8: reduces the effects of the alcohol.
column10: could multiply the effects of the alcohol.

column2: 30. When driving in icy or snowy conditions, to avoid crashes drivers should:
column4: engage 4 wheel drive on the vehicle.
column6: add extra weight to the vehicle to improve traction.
column8: reduce speed and increase following distance.
column10: get off the highway as quickly as possible.

column2: 31. Hydroplaning is a situation in which:
column4: your tires throw water to the rear, causing problems for the vehicles behind.
column6: your tires ride up on a thin surface of water, losing contact with the pavement, and resulting in sudden loss of control
column8: one of your tires goes flat, causing the others to skid.
column10: the tires of the car ahead cause sheets of water to splash on your vehicle.

column2: 32. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.
column6: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column8: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column10: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.

column2: 33. Vehicle stopping distance never depends on:
column4: the condition of your vehicle's brakes.
column8: the condition and type of vehicle tires.

column2: 34. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs can:
column4: improves concentration.
column6: have a less pronounced effect than either taken separately.
column8: have a more pronounced effect than either taken separately.

column2: 35. Drivers under 21 years of age are considered to be driving under the influence if their blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is:
column4: .05% or higher.
column8: .08% or higher.

column2: 36. Alcohol:
column4: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.
column6: makes it easier to make correct decisions.
column8: enhances your ability to see clearly.

column2: 37. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column4: Drinking coffee.
column8: Eating before or while you drink.
column10: Not drinking over a period of time.
